I usually like Red Robin.  We used to live near North County Fair in Escondido and really enjoyed Red Robin.  We were looking forward to trying this RR in Menifee and were unfortunately very disappointed.  First, it was a long wait and when they finally seated us in the bar, it was empty!  Why did we have to wait for 20 minutes when the bar was empty?  Then it was FREEZING.  The worst is when we looked at the ledge next to our table and it was thick with dust, I can only hope the kitchen looked better but I doubt it.  Then my husband  ordered a hamburger and they ask if you want it pink or no pink (like Applebees).  He said definitely NO PINK... you guessed it, pink and not nearly done enough.  Our server was very nice, but nothing could override everything else.  Will never go back to this Red Robin :(  I can tolerate a lot, but not a dirty restaurant.

Ordered an appetizer that came about 1min before our dinner came out. Asked to have it removed from my bill, and was offered a free dessert instead. Not going to make a big deal out of it, because the food was good. Just for future reference, don't order an appetizer with your meal!

This place never disappoints. We usually sit in the bar because the dining room is full of kids but that's fine with us. The bartenders and servers are so dialed in. So friendly, fast service, great burgers, and great prices.

Good food good beer selection always great service. Food comes out fast and hot. Mixed drinks are great. Always friendly staff. If you ever do have a problem management takes care of it no questions asked.
Avocado salad without any avocado.I gave my grandchild 4 bites of avocado cubes in my salad and realized there wasn't any left.

Me and my boyfriend went to red robin just to try it ! NEVER going back again , it was so hard to get hold of my waitress ! The fries smell like the dentist office "weird" my wings were definitely processed chicken just by the way it looked and smelled DISGUSTING!  The price for the cluck & fries is to high for the food you receive !

Overpriced burgers....I was in the area waiting for my dad so I decided to try the famous gourmet burger joint since the sushi place nearby hasn't open yet.  I saw the zagat rating on the front proclaiming the best gourmet burger so I was looking forward to it.   My review is solely based on the one burger I had, bleu cheese burger. The meat itself was good but the bleu cheese was overpowering. I had to skim off a big portion of it.  I like bleu cheese and I know how overpowering it can get but I thought a burger joint like Red Robin should know what they're doing considering they're the experts on burger.   The bottomless steak fries were good.  They provide you with their seasoning salt at the table.  The salt makes the fries extra yummy. They also provide bottomless drinks.  Service was excellent.   I'll probably try Red Robin again one of these day but a different burger next time...

HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Decided to stop in & have dinner with husband & 2 boys. Waited 5 minutes to be seated (not bad), but then after we were seated we waited & waited & waited. Waitress NEVER even looked at our table didn't even ask if we wanted water or anything to drink (no acknowledgment). After 15 minutes of waiting to see if a waitress will even come to our table we decided to go home instead & make dinner. 2nd attempt to eat there & both have been bad. Waitresses just stand in a corner yapping & not paying attention to customers.

I was pretty impressed by this Red Robin! We came in STARVING after taking our holiday photos in Murrieta - we asked for bottomless fries and freckled lemonade (my absolute favorite) right when we sat down and the manager brought it out right away. He was helping out the servers which is awesome. They took our order pretty quickly and the food was delicious as usual - they were late on bringing out my husband's onion rings and they took it off the bill for us. Chain restaurants can turn me off sometimes but I am a Red Robin fan for life - now if only they would open one in Oceanside!
Robyn gave us wonderful service and the food was great!! Never a disappointment here!!

The burgers are always awesome. Bottomless fries is a big plus. I come here a couple times a month and always have a pleasant experience. One trend I notice is they are taking some really great stuff off the menu. For example, the 5 Alarm burger (you can order off the menu but sometimes the newer servers have to go ask someone else about it), the Salmon burger (they don't carry salmon anymore), the artichoke dip (gone), the chili dishes (gone). They are adding things to the menu, which is good, but not good that they are 86'ing some of their other great stuff. They really need to bring that back. The Ultimate Margarita is the best!

Hmm...why do I like this place? Maybe it's because it's the only new sit down restaurant in this small town.  Maybe it's because my daughter, Robyn, likes to say the name.  Or maybe it's because the burgers are DAMN FRIGGIN' GOOD! Yeah, I'll pay $6 for a burger, Mr. Carls Jr.!!  Shit, it's about 9 bucks for a burger here but I think it's worth it.  The Blue Ribbon and A1 Peppercorn burgers are bomb-diggy.  What's more, there's a full bar to order some alcohol to wash it down!  Beer and burgers?  Sounds good to me. I do think that they should give a lot more fries though, since it's all you can eat.  Yeah they are large strips but it looks pretty funny getting only 6-8 fries with your burger and then the same amount when you ask for more. But it's not that big a deal for me.  Try the Red Robin seasoning on the fries, btw. Kids meals are a good size.  The 2 of mine are small so splitting a pizza satisfies them both.  Wife enjoys the bottomless Freckled Lemonade with real strawberries.  What can I say? There's something to please every one of us. I feel I'm getting my money's worth here, especially with the free refills on many of the food.  Staff is friendly and they always take note they we order 1 menu item for both my kids to share.  So when the food arrives they separate the food evenly and place them in individual baskets so my kids don't end up fighting over who gets what.  Yeah I know it's a minor thing but hey, I appreciate the gesture nonetheless. Very happy to have a new restaurant in town....and a good one at that!

Good idea for servers:  know your menu!  I was excited to see that they had some local craft beers on tap and to "ask your server which local beers were flowing ."   I did just that... She replied "oh I don't think we have any ."  Okay.... Moving on to their tap list I chose a Guinness.   She brought me a bottle and said " oh we only have it in bottles."   My food was ok... My wife's was cold, and not prepared to how it was ordered.  We were on a time constraint, or they would have heard all about this.   I used to be a regular at red robin... Oh, and I found out later that they had Stone AND Ironfire on tap...This experience confirms why I'm not a regular any longer.
Bonsai burger was great only if u like pineapple. The burger was juicy. Fries were  good. I didn't really like their clucks. 4 stars for the burger. Service was great the last time we went.

Our waitress Michelle was fantastic. Very attentive and polite despite the restaurant being very very busy.  The food came out promptly and the manager stopped by frequently to see how we were doing.  Kevin was also very helpful.  We come here often and love the food.  Great restaurant but the staff make all the difference.

Hate to say it but.....WHERES THE BEEF??? Was so excited to try this place out but was sadly disappointed by the 'fast food' like burger we received. While the flavor was ok (similar to the old Bob's Big Boy), so was the size. Remember how large a  Big Mac is? Its the same size burger with different toppings. Same bun, patty, etc. We all know a Big Mac is anything but Big. More like a tall mac! Not worth the price for a loud, overly hyped restaurant.

This location is mediocre.  Sort of loud and obnoxious.  I've had decent service, lousy service and good service over the times I've visited.  As a Seattle-ite, I'm a RR veteran, and this one is just ok.  The last two times I've ordered hamburgers, which either came out wrong or were not cooked as requested (medium's came out medium-rare). What's really bizarre is how busy this place can get.  It's as if it's the only restaurant in the area!  And when it's busy, the wait is annoyingly long and even though they have all sorts of people hosting, it's not a good experience; they yell for you, but you can't hear them or they miss people...really poorly organized. All-in-all, I may go here again when in the area, but I think I'll just stick with RR in the Northwest.
The food was good I had a teriyaki chicken sandwich it was excellent the salad was a little small bottomless fries were goodThe prices are a little high but overall the experience was pretty good

Came in at 7 pm for dinner. We were sat down and waited for over 15 minutes and nothing. My wife, kids, and I stood up and left. The waitress never looked at us nor did she even come by to offer a glass of water. I'll never eat at this place again.

Our waitress was friendly but the service was kind of slow. All of our drinks were constantly empty, and the place didn't seem too busy. Maybe they were short handed. We had a larger party I believe 9 of us. 3 ordered the same burger. 2 of the burgers can out raw. They brought out 2 more and one of them had toppings we asked not to have. Normally just me and my boyfriend go to red robin and the service and food is great. This time we were all disappointed. I dont know if having a larger party had anything to do with it or not . The manager did offer to comp the burgers. I'm sure we'll return but definitely be apprehensive about the food were served.
Excellent food.  Very good service.  Expensive.  Adequate parking.  Very high noise level.  Multiple big screen TV's.  They serve alcoholic drinks.
Quick friendly service, great food and love the rewards card and free burger on my birthday!

I had a horrible experience the on my last visit but a friend wanted to try it out again and since they have a good blue cheese hamburger I caved in. What a mistake. At one point we didn't see our waitress for 30 min, Yes 30 minutes, so no more fries for us. I was so frustrated by the lack of service I didn't eat my hamburger. Actually I didn't have time since the food was all brought at different times and most were done with their dinner by the time I received mine. I needed an order to go as well but had to goto the bar to order it separately since we couldn't find out waitress. The hostess grab water for us since our server disappeared. I mentioned it to a manager and much like the first experience he didn't seem to care. He barely looked up and just said I am sorry about that. The leadership is a joke and the service from most is non-existent. I will not be back, and it's too bad cause I do like their food. Luckily there are plans for some other restraints in the general area. This one needs to close.
The service here is ABSOULUTLY crap. The manager is constantly in another world. Our food portions got smaller and the workers cuss on the job. Definitely not coming back.

I've been to Red Robin tons of times and I love it so much I keep coming back.  I'm not a big complainer but the last time I went to the Red Robin in Menifee, the server dropped sauce on my purse and then disappeared and had someone else clean it up.  It seemed to freak her out a lot and she didn't handle the situation well at all even though I was not mad.  Other than that, service and food were awesome!

We tend to go to Red Robin for special celebrations. Yesterday was both Mother's day and my birthday. We had a very minimal wait, great service and great food. Refills kept coming, the staff were helpful & upbeat & on top of everything. We moved from Temecula to Menifee and still love that although Menifee is growing it still has that small town feeling, but we get the big town type service.

Not bad.  The french onion soup is good.  We would go here more often if they had some healthier choices.  Most of their entree salads are filled with fried stuff.  Huh?  I understand that places around here have to cater to the porker crowd to fill the tables.

We live in Menifee and frequent this location because we are limited in options. However since their latest menu change we are so disappointed!!! We hit it on Friday night during their happy hour but of course (all well drinks) includes crappy rum and tequila. And then we were charged full price or our appetizer which, even at happy hour prices wasn't worth it. I used to love the hummus plate with a wide variety of veggies but now it's chips ( soggy and fried), some cucumber and carrots. I'll never waste my money on that again.Service was fine but they have definitely skimped down on many of the menu items. I guess its another sign of the times!!!

This Red Robin happen to be nearby when I pulled off the highway.  The jingle rang in my head so why not. Both food and service were good. Employees were nice and always around when needed.  Got the Massive burger and when it arrived, it looked like it was made in a factory. Four pickles slapped on, a handful of onions, meat...you get the picture. The burger was good and plenty of fries. Great place for a quick stop and a $10 burger.
Great food, bottomless fries with almost every meal, and always good customer service. I appreciate that I never wait around for a refill as I am completely addicted to Diet Coke from the keg.
I can't give 5 stars because I have my favorites but this is a nice place. My kids like this place alot.

Minus a star for whomever created this with TWO Bs!!! Just kidding, but it is Red RoBin!  I take pride in Red Robin because it was my very first job... the one in Temecula, actually! I know what goes into what makes it special and YUMMY!! Even after working there, I still love to EAT there! Heck, I just love to eat!  I will say that upon walking in we were greeted with delight, and sat right away. It was quite busy for a Friday (Don't people work??!), but still in the manageable category of busy.  I had a CRAVING for a Blue Ribbon Burger, and because I'd never had it before, I figured , why not!!?? I've tried everything else on the menu!  But before I get into THAT yumminess, let's talk about the server...and the service. It was okay. I know right, after all that build up, you get "okay." Don't get me wrong, it wasn't horrible by any means, our server was mediocre. He didn't introduce himself with his name, but definitely welcomed us with a smile. I would have hoped for him to upsell their usual summer promotion, but he didn't do that. (We always had fun contests to entice us to upsell... just saying) A server should anticipate the next round of beverages, when they get low, and he did refill our waters without question. We only ordererd waters, and Dad ordered a Strawberry shake.  We ordered our food... the food arrived later than the 10 minutes they allow for entrees (Fun fact for you to take away: 8min appetizers). They probably took about 15-20 minutes to bring out our order. Nothing out of the ordinary, nothing special to customize the order... just three of their burgers...  My burgers definitly WoW's me... but only half fit in my belly.. the rest was dinner that night!  Nonetheless, we went to eat and accomplished our goal. The food is always tasty at Red RoBin, which is why I choose to continue to return. Maybe I am biased, but trust my taste buds, I know what I am doing!!  (I do wish this location had outdoor seating!)

Awful service. It was my birthday and the lady was so disrespectful towards me. Food was cold. I never received the appetizer I asked for, or the extra napkins and silverware. Our waitress didn't fill up drinks, or even ask us how the food was. Just awful if you ask me.
I have been here twice. I love red robin, but this particular one doesn't have the best service

Sat down with my 5 year old boy and 1 year old boy. Waited for over 20 minutes without even a hello from a server. Walked out right in front of management and they didn't even notice. Something needs to change. Very disappointed. 12/05/13 8:00PM.

This is the Red Robin I usually go to due to the fact that my Tuesday lunch friend works in that area. The food is always good and I can't recall a time we've ever had bad service there, which is good since we go pretty often.  Nobody can touch their turkey burgers! Theirs is my absolute favorite. It's not dry or texturally "bread-y" like most other turkey burgers are. Plus they have a chipotle sauce they use that is delicious.  They make excellent strawberry lemonade also. I'm not even a fan of strawberry lemonade so that's saying quite a lot! :) Also some of the best fish and chips I've ever had. Can't really go wrong with Red Robin in my opinion.

This is my second time at this location. My server (Michelle) is super nice and on her stuff! I came alone....waiting for my sister to get home... and she has been nothing but kind to me! I look around and see the other servers, hardly anyone smiling,  not too friendly...but I was taken care of. Food came out much faster then I expected and was delicious. I would definently come back! Thank you Michelle for the wonderful service!
Constantly good service, food is always correct and tastes good. Would recommend to fellow Menifee residents.

Cheap-quality burgers for $9+ per person (plus drink, tax, gratuity).  I'd rather go to Farmer Boys and spend less than half that amount for a real burger with all the bells & whistles!  Of course this is practically the only restaurant in Menifee, so I suppose it's "take it or leave it".

Food was great and hot great service, 3 Red robin in 5 days kids love it but especially this one,servers are polite and always check on you and constantly ask if everything is good, worth the wait on a Saturday night!!
Place sucks. Took forever to give us our food, drink, and also they gave me a melted milkshake. We had a great waitress but took too long for our food. 1/5

A few reasons why my husband & I adore this restaurant: 1) We always, always share a meal and NEVER get any lip about it. I don't eat much, & splitting a meal to leave room for dessert is how we do things. We've gone to a few other restaurants & gotten passive-aggressive sass from waiters who were bummed that their tip might be lower because of it.  2) We never waited around for ANYTHING. Refills, questions, more fries, sauces, whatever. We just barely looked up and around and BAM! our waiter was there to get us whatever we needed.  3) Service from everyone has been top-notch. Hosts, servers, managers, bussers; everyone was glad to be working there it seemed.  We have inadvertently gone here to celebrate a few big occasions; closing escrow, our engagement dinner, our anniversary, etc. and each time has been amazing. I suppose we wanted to go somewhere where we knew we'd have a wonderful time.

I've always enjoyed Red Robin. The burgers have always been good, and their oreo chocolate shake is delicious. The appetizers are good as well, and my favorite is the fried zucchini with ranch. For a chain restaurant the quality is high. I put my stamp of approval on Red Robin.

Red Robin makes consistently good food. It is a nice place to bring the family. If you get "endless fries" for one of your kids, or you.... think of telling the waiter in advance that you will definitely be needing more... do it right away, or it might take a bit of time. Here is another tip: Sign up for their burger club... cause every 10th burger is free, and you just have to use your card every time; it will automatically come right off the bill when you earn it or other perks. Personally, I like the wraps, they make good wraps.
My server was absolutely amazing. Her name is Brittany and she was great at answering any and all of my questions. She was friendly, personable & honestly she's the reason I'll be coming back.

We had an awesome experience here the other night. It was pretty crowded when we got here, but they got us in very quickly. They acknowledged us right away at the table and brought our drinks out fast.  My son ordered the guacamole bacon burger with no onions but substituted the onion straws instead. It came out with lots of onions no onion straws and almost no guacamole at all. We ask them to fix it, and not only did they fix it quickly , the manager came right over to apologize. Then they took the cost of the burger off our bill. I didn't ask for them to do that nor did I expect it, but I really appreciated how they went out of their way to make us happy.  These people have customer service down and that is something that's mostly lost in society today.   I will absolutely be back to this location without any question at all. I highly recommend it to anybody looking for a great burger and awesome customer service.  And by the way we all loved our food as well.
Bartender Alex was amazing on a busy Friday night!  2/27/15 Very professional, fast and courteous! Highly recommend the bar area and food was very good too!

Yikes. I went here durin a busy lunch hour and was so disappointed in the waitresses they have. I've given this place several chances and I think it gets worse each time. My burger was cold and the cheese wasn't even melted. It was greasy and sloppy...my iced tea cup was empty nearly the entire time.

Burgers are not what they used to be.  Bunch of lettuce filler, meat seems thinner and lacking flavor. Service was good, friendly. Small amount of fries, ask for more and get a small helping. Seems everything is scaled back except prices. Over $50 for 2 adults and 2 younger kids, no alcohol.  Who has a good burger anymore?
Use to be our favorite place.  Last few times we have gone it's been horrible service and food.  We won't be going back.

My family loves this place!  The burgers and fries, I must say, are to die for.  Not only that but their shakes are delicious.  Another reason why I love this place is that I coach the Menifee Valley Little League Farm A's and they helped me out with an MVP award by giving me free milk shakes to give each player who wins the MVP, which of course is all of them.  The servers are always kind and helpful.  I always get my order exactly how I ordered it and any time I have any complications they are always doing their best to solve it.  And yes when they are busy, they are busy but again that's like any place you go with great food.  I would recommend this establishment to family and friends...and I will definitely be returning soon.

Just dropped in for a quick lunch while running errands, and was promptly greeted  by 2 very friendly first contact hostesses and was seated immediately.  Clean restaurant, professionally dressed and customer service oriented wait staff who were knowledgeable about the menu even making suggestions.  Robyn was our waitress and she's the kind of person who really gets what a waitress is supposed to be!  You know, some people are just people people and then there's DMV workers disguised as wait staff. When the menu boasts 'Build your burger from bun to bun", they really mean it!  Both my sister and I tweeked up some of their regular burgers to suit our chicken wants, not burger wants and were both served FANTASTIC chicken sandwiches both perfectly done to our unique preferences!  Great food, great wait staff, friendly and knowledgable and eager to make you feel right at home!  Now THAT'S where I want to spend my food dollar!  Kudos Robyn and Red Robin, we will DEFINITELY be back!

The meal was great but my waitress was not a multi-tasker.  It took 7 minutes to get a drink order in, and 5 to receive the drink. Then 10 minutes after all that our meal order was taken. I think she was usually the bartender but I am not sure. I won't even mention how long it took to get the food and the check.
I've had bad Red Robbin experiences in the past and this location redeems them! Great staff and location! I'm very happy! Try the Peppercorn Burger!
Wow waaaay better than than In your mouth n Out your hole. Bottomless fries are delicious the burger is better.

My kids love this place but I find myself running out of menu options now that we've been there half a dozen times since moving here in 2009.  My kids love the balloons and strawberry lemonades.  As for me and the wife, we have grown tired of the menu and appetizers.  The shakes are a delight, but everything else is getting old.  Every time we look at the menu we hope to see something enticing, and never do.  We've tried the likes of the whiskey river BBQ burger and chili nachos and still yearn for something better.  The best sandwich in our opinion is the bruschetta chicken sandwich.  This is a restaurant we frequent due to location and default of anything better.  Service wise, the hostesses are the highlight, the servers are mediocre, and the management makes its perfunctory rounds.

So I'm sitting here right now for about 20 minutes and no one has come to even take a drink order. Three waitresses have walk by and no acknowledgment and I'm pretty sure this older guy is a manager who has walked by twice. Jeez no help here. Time to leave.
Food is ok. Prices are a little high on the hamburgers. Service was great! Worth a try and always busy!

I liked the fact that you can substitute a veggie burger for any burger on the menu. I also liked that you could substitute another side dish for the french fries, mostly at no extra charge. The service was good, but the restaurant was kept a little too cold. Attention:restaurant managers-you will save $ on electricity and keep the customers in the store longer if you don't freeze them out!

today i had the octoberfest burger and oh myyy, it was dee lish. never thought i'd like the month of october for more than its the month of halloween but now i have something else to look forward to when october comes around. pretzel bread with honey mustard slabbed on both buns, grilled onions, lettuce, swiss cheese and a juicy all beef patty cooked to your liking. i suggest getting your but into red robin and not even looking at the menu and just ordering the octoberfest burger. you wont regret it. and the bottomless steak fries are a plus ;)
happy hour specials in the bar and late night specials are great. beer is always nice and cold and the burgers are good. service is also good. not a good place to see a game on TV

anyone who has been to a red robin knows that they are a little pricey but that's what you expect and the food is worth it. i've been to a bunch of red robin's all over the place and the service here is by far the best. they always seem to be on it. the baskets of fries keep coming and so do the drink refills. best place to eat in the area for restaurant style food.
